comment: The class is very lecture heavy and so you have to take good notes on both the PowerPoints and what she says in class. She's an easy grader and responded to emails fast.

B/c it was an online class, we didn't see much of her, but she gave us all the materials we needed to succeed. If you just read the material (even just skim), watch the lectures/DOCU.s she puts up & occasionally read the textbook when she emphasizes it, you'll easily get an A. Class just requires common sense & her accent wasn't hard to understand.
There was a lot of reading but they were (mostly) interesting. However, she does not respond in a timely manner and it does not connect to her students very much at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Was very hard to reach outside of online class. She has an accent which can be hard to understand. Tough grader when it comes to essays and discussions. Quizzes only had 5 questions so if you miss one then you blow your grade. Very textbook and video heavy. Did offer some extra credit but it didn't help much.

speaks very fast in a heavy accent, makes it very hard to understand the content. Powerpoints that she teaches from are never on the test, so there is no point in going to class. Tests are worth a MASSIVE portion of the grade and there are only 2 of them, so if you mess up one you have to do insanely good on the quizzes and the next test to fix it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was her first online class, so I won't be too harsh. However, the first course that I got C in four semesters. Lots of articles to read, and documentaries to watch. Quizes every week based on the articles. Read the syllabus carefully and mark dpost dates, because it doesn't show on the timeline in d2l( and neither she makes an announcement)

I took this class online and she really didnt interact at all the entire semester with the class. It was IMPOSSIBLE to reach her and she did not respond to any of my emails. Her work is easy but the lack of communication was awful. Ended up having to contact the dept. chair over it. Dont take online!

Cares about what she teaches. thought it would be a fun class, it mainly turns into gender debates. Still easy. haven't opened the book and have gotten at least a B if not an A on all quizzes and tests (hybrid, so they were online). Just pay some attention. Her lectures are terrible, pastes 3 paragraphs on 1 slide, then reads at nascar speed.

Dr. Sadequee is a good teacher. I think a lot of people have an issue with her heavy accent, but as a person thats not great at understanding accents, trust me when I say its really not that bad. Shes thorough in her lectures, but she doesnt post the powerpoints online, so coming to class is necessary. Her tests are pretty easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy
